intro: Fraxinus excelsior subsp. australis, commonly known as the European ash, is a deciduous tree native to southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 20–30 meters, featuring a straight trunk and a broad, rounded crown. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a serrated margin, turning yellow in autumn. Its flowers are small and green, appearing in catkins, and it produces samaras as its fruit. This subspecies is adapted to a variety of soil types but prefers moist, well-drained conditions.
